title: Have a problem to solve
text: Synthetic examples won't help, and training projects won't help either. Apply your knowledge directly to your own projects. You should have some idea for an app, or website, or just a problem to solve.

title: Read documentation first
text: The most value I got when debugging something was to go and read official documentation first on MDN. It will be the most up to date version of what you can read.

title: Read articles
text: Subscribe to The Startup, to JavaScript weekly newsletter and to HackerNews newsletter.

title: Read the code
text: Go to GitHub repo of your favorite js library and read it's source code. You will learn a lot from this. You can also go to some very popular libraries with a really small amount of code.

title: Learn other languages
text: Haskell  -  for functional programming, function signatures. Python  -  for general scripting.
